1.text: Cut the cream cheese into cubes to help it soften more quickly.

2.text: Leave the cream cheese at room temperature for 30 minutes to soften it.

3.text: Stir your cream cheese for about 5 minutes to soften it manually.

4.text: Spread the cream cheese out thinly to help soften even more quickly.

5.text: Press a spoon into the cream cheese to see if it’s soft enough.

6.text: Don't let softened cream cheese sit for more than 2 hours.

7.text: Microwave the cream cheese in 15-second increments to soften it quickly.

8.text: Place the cream cheese in a water bath for 10 minutes to warm it gradually.

9.text: Avoid over-heating the cream cheese to preserve its texture.

10.text: Add milk or cream to soften the cheese without changing the taste.

11.text: Add melted butter for smooth, thin cream cheese.

12.text: Try adding 1 teaspoon (4.9 mL) of lemon juice to add a little tartness.

13.text: Mix the cream cheese with whipped cream to add sweetness.

14.text: Mix the cream cheese with mascarpone to soften it slightly.
